hints_html:
The power set is the set of all subsets of a set.

The number of elements of the power set of a set with \(n\) elements is \(2^n\).
hints_latex: The power set is the set of all subsets of a set.

The number of elements of the power set of a set with $n$ elements is
$2^n$.
hints_raw:
The power set is the set of all subsets of a set.
The number of elements of the power set of a set with <math>n</math> elements is <math>2^n</math>.
question: 1 (j)
statement_html: Let \(\displaystyle A\) be the set \(\{ 1, x, y\}\). What is the power set \(\displaystyle \mathcal{P}(A)\)?
statement_latex:
Let $\displaystyle A$ be the set $\{ 1, x, y\}$. What is the power set
$\displaystyle \mathcal{P}(A)$?
statement_raw: Let <math> \displaystyle A </math> be the set <math> \{ 1, x, y\} </math>. What is the power set <math>\displaystyle \mathcal{P}(A) </math>?
